page.title: 14LANDSCAPE.
page.content: {RURAL EAST LEICESTERSHIRE Owston is set in the rolling east Leicestshire countryside on a north slope on mostly clay soil. With the exception of Owston Woods, the area is farmed with a traditional field structure containing grass and arable crops. The older grass fields show ridge and furrow formation and west and south of the village earthworks are evident. Although hedge_cutting machinery is used, the skilful craft of hedge laying is retained. There has been extensive tree planting and ageing hedgerow trees are being replaced. There are numerous public footpaths and minor roads which are kept in reasonably good repair and there are many springs and small streams and a ford at Newbold. The church is on the edge of the village - most farms have modern barns.
